$$
Q=\sqrt{\frac{x^2+y^2}{2}}, A=\frac{x+y}{2}, G=\sqrt{x y}, H=\frac{2 x y}{x+y} .
$$

& (x+y)^2>\frac{x^2+y^2}{2}+x y+\sqrt{2 x y\left(x^2+y^2\right)} \Leftrightarrow \frac{1}{2}(x+y)^2>\sqrt{2 x y\left(x^2+y^2\right)} \Leftrightarrow \\

\end{aligned}
